channel.title: events on darktable Lua documentation
channel.description: Recent content in events on darktable Lua documentation

item.title: overview
item.description: This section documents events that can be used to trigger Lua callbacks.

item.title: collection-changed
item.description:
event

This event is triggered whenever the lighttable collection changes. The event triggers anytime the collection module rules change, including simply adding a rule, so the user needs to check to ensure there is actually a change by keeping track of the number of images or checking the collection rules.

ðŸ”—collection-changed.callback

function(
  event : string,
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.

ðŸ”—collection-changed.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: darkroom-image-history-changed
item.description:
event

This event is triggered from darkroom view whenever an image’s history has changed and another image is being loaded or darkroom view is being changed to another view.

ðŸ”—darkroom-image-history-changed.callback

function(
  event : string,
  image : types.dt_lua_image_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • image - types.dt_lua_image_t - The image loaded into darkroom view

ðŸ”—darkroom-image-history-changed.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: darkroom-image-loaded
item.description:
event

This event is triggered whenever an image is loaded in darkroom view

ðŸ”—darkroom-image-loaded.callback

function(
  event : string,
  image : types.dt_lua_image_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • image - types.dt_lua_image_t - The image loaded into darkroom view

ðŸ”—darkroom-image-loaded.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: exit
item.description:
event

This event is triggered when darktable exits, it allows lua scripts to do cleanup jobs

ðŸ”—events.exit.callback

function(
)

ðŸ”—events.exit.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: global_toolbox-grouping_toggle
item.description:
event

This event is triggered after the user toggled the grouping button.

ðŸ”—global_toolbox-grouping_toggle.callback

function(
  toggle : boolean
)
  • toggle - boolean - the new grouping status.

ðŸ”—global_toolbox-grouping_toggle.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: global_toolbox-overlay_toggle
item.description:
event

This event is triggered after the user toggled the overlay button.

ðŸ”—global_toolbox-overlay_toggle.callback

function(
  toggle : boolean
)
  • toggle - boolean - the new overlay status.

ðŸ”—global_toolbox-overlay_toggle.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: image-group-information-changed
item.description:
event

This event is called when image grouping information changes.

ðŸ”—image-group-information-changed.callback

function(
  event : string,
  reason : string,
  image : types.dt_lua_image_t,
  group_leader : types.dt_lua_image_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • reason - string - The reason grouping changed. One of add, remove, leader-change, remove-leader.
  • image - types.dt_lua_image_t - The image object that the change applies to.
  • group_leader - types.dt_lua_image_t - The image object that is the group leader

ðŸ”—image-group-information-changed.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: inter-script-communication
item.description:
event

This event is called to send messages back and forth between scripts.

ðŸ”—inter-script-communication.callback

function(
  event : string,
  sender : string,
  receiver : string,
  message : string
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • sender - string - The name of the module sending the event.
  • receiver - string - The name of the module that the event is being sent to or broadcast for all modules.
  • message - string - The message intended for the receiving module

ðŸ”—inter-script-communication.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: intermediate-export-image
item.description:
event

This event is called each time an image is exported, once for each image after the image has been processed to an image format but before the storage has moved the image to its final destination. The call is blocking.

ðŸ”—intermediate-export-image.callback

function(
  event : string,
  image : types.dt_lua_image_t,
  filename : string,
  format : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t,
  storage : types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • image - types.dt_lua_image_t - The image object that has been exported.
  • filename - string - The name of the file that is the result of the image being processed.
  • format - types.dt_imageio_module_format_t - The format used to export the image.
  • storage - types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t - The storage used to export the image (can be nil).

ðŸ”—intermediate-export-image.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: mouse-over-image-changed
item.description:
event

This event is triggered whenever the image under the mouse changes

ðŸ”—mouse-over-image-changed.callback

function(
  event : string,
  image : types.dt_lua_image_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • image - types.dt_lua_image_t - The new image under the mouse, can be nil if there is no image under the mouse

ðŸ”—mouse-over-image-changed.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: pixelpipe-processing-complete
item.description:
event

This event is triggered when a pixelpipe processing run is complete.

ðŸ”—pixelpipe-processing-complete.callback

function(
  event : string,
  image : types.dt_lua_image_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • image - types.dt_lua_image_t - The image loaded into darkroom view

ðŸ”—pixelpipe-processing-complete.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: post-import-film
item.description:
event

This event is triggered when an film import is finished (all post-import-image callbacks have already been triggered). This event can be registered multiple times.

ðŸ”—post-import-film.callback

function(
  event : string,
  film : types.dt_lua_film_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • film - types.dt_lua_film_t - The new film that has been added. If multiple films were added recursively only the top level film is reported.

ðŸ”—post-import-film.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: post-import-image
item.description:
event

This event is triggered whenever a new image is imported into the database. This event can be registered multiple times, all callbacks will be called. The call is blocking.

ðŸ”—post-import-image.callback

function(
  event : string,
  image : types.dt_lua_image_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • image - types.dt_lua_image_t - The image object that has been imported.

ðŸ”—post-import-image.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: pre-import
item.description:
event

This event is trigger before any import action

ðŸ”—pre-import.callback

function(
  event : string,
  images : table of string
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • images - table of string - The files that will be imported. Modifying this table will change the list of files that will be imported.

ðŸ”—pre-import.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: selection-changed
item.description:
event

This event is triggered whenever the selection of images changes

ðŸ”—selection-changed.callback

function(
  event : string
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.

ðŸ”—selection-changed.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.

item.title: shortcut
item.description:
event

This event registers a new keyboard shortcut. The shortcut isn’t bound to any key until the users does so in the preference panel. The event is triggered whenever the shortcut is triggered. This event can only be registered once per value of shortcut.

ðŸ”—shortcut.callback

function(
  event : string,
  shortcut : string
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • shortcut - string - The tooltip string that was given at registration time.

ðŸ”—shortcut.extra registration parameters

  • tooltip - string - The string that will be displayed on the shortcut preference panel describing the shortcut.

item.title: view_changed
item.description:
event

This event is triggered after the user changed the active view

#view-changed.callback

function(
  event : string,
  old_view : types.dt_lua_view_t,
  new_view : types.dt_lua_view_t
)
  • event - string - The name of the event that triggered the callback.
  • old_view - types.dt_lua_view_t - The view that we just left
  • new_view - types.dt_lua_view_t - The view we are now in

#view-changed.extra registration parameters

This event has no extra registration parameters.
